intro: Acrostichum andicola, commonly known as the Andean fern, is a species of fern native to the Andes Mountains. It is characterized by its large, leathery fronds that can reach lengths of up to two meters. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Its rhizomes are fibrous and help it anchor in rocky or soil substrates. Acrostichum andicola plays a vital role in maintaining the ecological balance of its habitat by providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
